question.title: BUILD FAILED on almost empty project in Netbeans with JSP
question.body:
I am trying to run a simple project in Netbeans 16. It has only 2 files:

index.jsp with this content:

<%@page contentType="text/html" pageEncoding="UTF-8"%>
<%@page import="rutines.Rutines"%>
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">
        <title>JSP Page</title>
    </head>
    <body>
        <h1>Hello World!</h1>
        <% out.print("<p>I aix√≤ des de Java</p>"); %>
        <% out.print(Rutines.saluda()); %>       
    </body>
</html>

and the Rutines.java:

public class Rutines {
    public static String saluda() {
        return "Salutacions des d'una rutina";
    }
}

The project structure is:

And when trying to clean and build, the output is:

ant -f C:\\exercicis\\DAM2\\M9\\UF3\\jsp -Dnb.internal.action.name=rebuild -DforceRedeploy=false -Dbrowser.context=C:\\exercicis\\DAM2\\M9\\UF3\\jsp clean dist
init:
undeploy-clean:
deps-clean:
do-clean:
Deleting directory C:\exercicis\DAM2\M9\UF3\jsp\build
check-clean:
clean:
init:
deps-module-jar:
deps-ear-jar:
deps-jar:
Created dir: C:\exercicis\DAM2\M9\UF3\jsp\build\web\WEB-INF\classes
Created dir: C:\exercicis\DAM2\M9\UF3\jsp\build\web\META-INF
Copying 1 file to C:\exercicis\DAM2\M9\UF3\jsp\build\web\META-INF
Copying 2 files to C:\exercicis\DAM2\M9\UF3\jsp\build\web
library-inclusion-in-archive:
library-inclusion-in-manifest:
Created dir: C:\exercicis\DAM2\M9\UF3\jsp\build\empty
Created dir: C:\exercicis\DAM2\M9\UF3\jsp\build\generated-sources\ap-source-output
Compiling 1 source file to C:\exercicis\DAM2\M9\UF3\jsp\build\web\WEB-INF\classes
BUILD FAILED (total time: 0 seconds)

I tried to compile from command line using

javac Rutines.java

And the Rutines.class is created with no errors.

Any idea of what's going on?

Thanks

Carles
